episodeTitle: Luffy at Full Power! Nami's Courage and the Straw Hat!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィ全開！ナミの決意と麦わら帽子
episodeTitleRomanized: Rufi Zenkai! Nami no Ketsui to Mugiwara Bōshi
description: Nami refuses Arlong's ultimatum and chooses to fight alongside her crew. Sanji dives underwater to free Luffy from cement while the crew battles Arlong's officers. Luffy emerges and begins his confrontation with Arlong.

events.title: Nami Refuses Arlong's Ultimatum
events.description: Arlong offers Nami an ultimatum: return as his cartographer or he will kill her village. Nami courageously refuses, choosing to fight alongside the Straw Hat crew despite the danger to the villagers.
events.significance: This marks Nami's decisive break from Arlong and her commitment to trusting Luffy and the crew to save her village, demonstrating her growth from acting alone to relying on her friends.

quotes.text: I'm going to fight with them!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's declaration of allegiance to the Straw Hat crew

events.title: Sanji Dives to Rescue Luffy
events.description: With Luffy trapped underwater in cement, Sanji bravely dives into the pool to break the cement and free him, despite knowing he'll be at a disadvantage against the fish-men in their element.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's selflessness and establishes the recurring pattern of Sanji being the one who rescues Luffy from drowning throughout the series.

events.title: Hatchan Pursues Sanji Underwater
events.description: Hatchan regains consciousness and pursues Sanji underwater as he attempts to free Luffy from the cement, creating additional danger for the Straw Hat cook.
events.significance: Adds tension to Sanji's rescue mission and demonstrates the fish-men's underwater advantage.

events.title: Hatchan's Takoyaki Punch
events.description: Hatchan demonstrates his Takoyaki Punch technique, using his six octopus arms to punch rapidly at his opponent underwater.
events.significance: First showcase of Hatchan's signature fighting technique utilizing his octopus fish-man physiology.

quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hatchan attacks with his signature move

events.title: Sanji Frees Luffy from Cement
events.description: Sanji successfully breaks the cement block attached to Luffy's feet, freeing him from drowning. Nojiko helps pull Luffy to the surface.
events.significance: Crucial rescue moment that allows Luffy to rejoin the battle against Arlong and represents Sanji's role as the crew's protector in water-related emergencies.

events.title: Luffy Emerges from the Water
events.description: After being freed by Sanji, Luffy launches himself out of the pool and into the air, ready to fight Arlong with renewed determination.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Luffy's direct confrontation with Arlong and demonstrates his resilience after nearly drowning.

events.title: Usopp Announces Victory Over Chew
events.description: Usopp appears and announces his victory against Chew, one of Arlong's top officers, demonstrating his contribution to the battle despite his fears.
events.significance: Shows Usopp's growth as a warrior and contributes to the crew's overall success against the Arlong Pirates.

events.title: Zoro Battles Arlong
events.description: Zoro engages Arlong in combat, attempting to break the fish-man's saw-like nose that Arlong claims is indestructible. The battle demonstrates both fighters' strength and determination.
events.significance: Important battle that tests Zoro's abilities against one of the strongest enemies the crew has faced, while Zoro is still recovering from Mihawk's wounds.

quotes.text: Your nose is indestructible? Let's test that!
quotes.speaker: Zoro

events.title: Arlong's Shark on Darts Attack
events.description: Arlong demonstrates his devastating Shark on Darts attack, propelling himself like a torpedo at Zoro and piercing him with his saw-like nose.
events.significance: First display of Arlong's signature technique and demonstrates the deadly power of fish-man physiology combined with weaponized body parts.

events.title: Arlong Notices Zoro's Mihawk Wounds
events.description: After defeating Zoro, Arlong removes Zoro's bandages and notices the massive wounds he sustained from Dracule Mihawk, realizing Zoro has been fighting while severely injured.
events.significance: Reveals to Arlong (and reinforces to viewers) the severity of Zoro's injuries from Mihawk, making his current fighting even more impressive and highlighting his dedication.

quotes.text: These wounds... you've been fighting in this condition?
quotes.speaker: Arlong

events.title: Luffy Confronts Arlong
events.description: Luffy directly confronts Arlong, mocking his fish-man appearance and preparing for their climactic battle. The tension builds as the two captains face off.
events.significance: Sets up the final confrontation between Luffy and Arlong that will determine Nami's freedom and the fate of Cocoyasi Village.

quotes.text: I'm the man who'll become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his dream while facing Arlong

quotes.text: I'm going to fight with them!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's declaration to fight alongside the Straw Hats

quotes.text: I'm the man who'll become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

themes.description: Nami's decision to trust Luffy and fight alongside the crew represents her emotional breakthrough from years of isolation and self-reliance.
themes.symbolism: The Straw Hat represents the bond between Luffy and Nami, symbolizing trust and protection.

themes.description: Sanji risks his life diving underwater to save Luffy, while Zoro continues fighting despite severe injuries from Mihawk, demonstrating the crew's willingness to sacrifice for each other.
themes.symbolism: The underwater rescue symbolizes the depths to which the crew will go to protect each other.

themes.description: The crew's coordinated assault on Arlong Park represents their united stand against tyranny and their determination to free Nami and her village.
themes.symbolism: Arlong Park as a fortress represents the seemingly insurmountable power of oppression that must be torn down.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami makes the crucial decision to trust her friends and fight alongside them, marking her true acceptance into the crew.
keyActions: Chooses to fight with the Straw Hats
Demonstrates courage despite fear for the villagers
quotes: I'm going to fight with them!

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji establishes his role as the crew member who rescues Luffy from water, risking his own safety.
keyActions: Successfully breaks the cement freeing Luffy

characterSpotlights.development: Despite nearly drowning, Luffy emerges ready to fight and confronts Arlong with unwavering confidence.
quotes: I'm the man who'll become the Pirate King!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro fights Arlong despite his severe injuries from Mihawk, demonstrating his incredible willpower and dedication.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several battle sequences and adds more dramatic tension to Sanji's underwater rescue compared to the manga.
Additional dialogue and reactions from the villagers watching the battle were added in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on September 13, 2000, and covers portions of manga chapters 88, 89, and 90.
The episode has an IMDb rating of 8.1/10, reflecting its importance in the Arlong Park Arc.
Sanji rescuing Luffy from water establishes a recurring pattern throughout the series where Sanji is typically the first to dive in after Luffy when he falls into the sea.
The ending song 'RUN! RUN! RUN!' by Maki Otsuki, who also performed the first ending theme 'Memories', features the Straw Hat crew members as children.
